briefTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study of the Combination Therapy of T-614 and Methotrexate in Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients With an Inadequate Response to Methotrexate

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion criteria:

* Subjects who have a diagnosis of Rheumatoid Arthritis by the ACR criteria
* Age greater or 20 years and less than 70 years old

Exclusion criteria:

* Subject who is considered by the investigator, for any reason, to be an unsuitable candidate for the study
* Women of childbearing potential who are not practicing a successful method of contraception, or wish to become pregnant

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Tender Joint Counts and Swollen Joint Counts
outcomeMeasures.description: Assessment of individual ACR core components like Tender Joint Counts (TJC) and Swollen Joint Counts (SJC)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in PAP, PtGADA and PyGADA
outcomeMeasures.description: Patient's assessment of pain (PAP), patient's global assessment of disease activity (PtGADA) and physician's global assessment of disease activity (PyGADA) each was assessed on a visual analog scale ranging from 0-100 mm, with higher scores indicating severe disease.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI)
outcomeMeasures.description: HAQ-DI was a participant assessed measure of health assessment, measured on a single scale ranging from 0 (no difficulty) to 3 (unable to do), with higher scores indicating severe disease.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in C-reactive Protein (CRP)
outcomeMeasures.description: Assessment of individual ACR core components i.e. CRP

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR)
outcomeMeasures.description: Assessment of individual ACR core components i.e. ESR

outcomeMeasures.title: Disease Activity Score in 28 Joints (DAS28): The Rates of Remission (DAS28-CRP Less Than 2.6), and Low Disease Activity (DAS28-CRP Less Than 3.2)
outcomeMeasures.description: The DAS28 is a composite score derived from 4 of these measures i.e count of 28 swollen joints, 28 tender joints, measure erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) or C reactive protein (CRP) and to make a 'global assessment of health' (indicated by marking a 10 cm line between very good and very bad). DAS28 is assessed as score on scale from 0 to 10 indicating current rheumatoid arthritis (RA) disease activity (0= low disease activity and 10 = high disease activity).

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of ACR 50 Criteria Responders
outcomeMeasures.description: ACR50 response is defined as at least a 50% improvement in tender joint count and swollen joint count, and in three of five of the following measures: patient pain intensity assessment, patient global assessment, physician global assessment, Health assessment questionnaire disability index (HAQ-DI), and an acute phase reactant \[erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) or C-reactive protein (CRP)\].

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of ACR 70 Criteria Responders
outcomeMeasures.description: ACR70 response is defined as at least a 70% improvement in tender joint count and swollen joint count, and in three of five of the following measures: patient pain intensity assessment, patient global assessment, physician global assessment, Health assessment questionnaire disability index (HAQ-DI), and an acute phase reactant \[erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) or C-reactive protein (CRP)\].

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of American College of Rheumatology [ACR] 20 Criteria Responders
outcomeMeasures.description: ACR20 response is defined as at least a 20% improvement in tender joint count and swollen joint count, and in three of five of the following measures: patient pain intensity assessment, patient global assessment, physician global assessment, Health assessment questionnaire disability index (HAQ-DI), and an acute phase reactant \[erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) or C-reactive protein (CRP)\].
